psychosis.topic: Chronic pain and its emotional impact
psychosis.description: I am struggling with ongoing pain from my shoulder surgery and herniated disc, which contributes to feelings of helplessness and frustration.
I believe my physical condition is permanent and that I will never return to my former self, which increases my anxiety and despair.

psychosis.topic: Pressure to appear strong and cheerful
psychosis.description: I feel that I must act happy and put on a brave face to be accepted and loved by others, even when I am in pain.
I often rely on the guidance and reassurance of others, treating their opinions as absolute truths to make sense of my situation.
I avoid expressing my true emotions and hide my pain by acting as though I am okay, fearing rejection if I reveal my struggles.

psychosis.topic: Fear of abandonment due to illness
psychosis.description: I worry that others will leave me once they realize the full extent of my physical and emotional struggles.

psychosis.topic: Hysteria in response to overwhelming stress
psychosis.description: When overwhelmed, such as after receiving the MRI report, I experience hysteria and struggle to manage my emotions.
At social events like the Halloween party, I compare myself to others, perceiving them as healthier and more carefree, which deepens my sadness.
